data.text:
Detailed Solution

Download Solution PDF

The correct answer is 1932.Key Points

John Galsworthy was an English novelist and playwright.

His notable works include The Forsyte Saga and its sequels, A Modern Comedy and End of the Chapter.

He won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1932.

The Forsyte Saga, first published under that title in 1922, is a series of three novels and two interludes.

Therefore, 'option 2' is the correct answer.Additional Information

The Forsyte Saga consisted of the novel The Man of Property (1906), the interlude (a short story) “Indian Summer of a Forsyte” (1918), the novel In Chancery (1920), the interlude “Awakening” (1920), and the novel To Let (1921).
